item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make The Berkeley Initiative for Transparency in the Social Sciences works to improve the credibility of science by advancing transparency, reproducibility, rigor, and ethics in research. https://www.bitss.org 1. What do they do? They collaborate with researchers, students, faculty, publishers, and funders across disciplines to: Generate evidence on problems and solutions in science through meta-research led by BITSS investigators and our broader community.

item.title: SHARE
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make SHARE is a community open-source initiative developing tools and services to connect related, yet distributed, research outputs, enabling new kinds of scholarly discovery. The National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) is currently supporting SHARE in a project to integrate digital humanities into the scholarly web. https://www.share-research.org/ 1.
